CatDescriptText: Ed Nacey, taxicab driver, West Homestead, and Louise Patay, clerk, Johnstown, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, June 4, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you think there is immediate danger of a third world war?  Why? If so, whom do you think our allies will be?"  Mr. Nacey's answer reads: "No, I think that Russia has all that she can take care of with 80 per cent of the world's population sitting beneath her.  I'm talking about the Chinese Communists.  If things come to a showdown we probably will be standing shoulder-to-shoulder with the Russians."  Ms. Patay's answer reads: "No, not really.  It just doesn't seem possibly..."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Ed Nacey wearing eyeglasses and poppy in breast pocket, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Louise Patay wearing dark horizontal striped dress, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
